get.description: The Account List endpoint returns all a list of accounts or products (and their associated data) held by the End User with a Provider.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for users(User access token)

Institutions under maintenance.value:
{
    "status": 401,
    "message": "This institution is not available due to maintenance",
    "data": null,
    "error_code": "0000",
    "error_message": "This institution is not available due to maintenance"
}

message.example: This institution is not available due to maintenance

error_message.example: This institution is not available due to maintenance

get.description: Once you get the user access token using the widget, The Account endpoint allows developers to retrieve data associated with the specified ‘account_id’ in their backend.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Account If for which the details are needed

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for user(User access token)

Institutions under maintenance.value:
{
    "status": 401,
    "message": "This institution is not available due to maintenance",
    "data": null,
    "error_code": "0000",
    "error_message": "This institution is not available due to maintenance"
}

message.example: This institution is not available due to maintenance

error_message.example: This institution is not available due to maintenance

get.description: The Transactions endpoint allows clients to receive user authorized transactions. Transactions data is standardised across financial institutions and accounts.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Unique Identifier of end user(User access token)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Returns transactions posted on or after this date. Default value is date as of the API request minus 3 months

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Returns transactions up to and including this date. Default value is date as of the API request

Result.value:
{
  "status": 200,
  "message": "OK",
  "lastUpdateAt": "2022-01-04 16:42 GMT+0700",
  "session": "valid",
  "data": [

}

get.description:
The Average Balance GET API will allow clients to receive user authorized average balance.
It can be generated with selected period of month&year

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for end-user(User access token)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Starting date Form date(format - MM-YYYY)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Starting date To date(format - MM-YYYY)

data.example: Parameter from and to are mandatory

get.description: This API furnishes the data on monthly basics and helps you get the Beginning balance, Ending balance, Daily balance, Average balance, Income source, and expenses destination.

parameters.name: user_access_token
parameters.description: Unique identification token for end user.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Starting date Form date(format - MM-YYYY)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date till you want a data(format - MM-YYYY)

from and to are mandatory.value:
{
    "status": 400,
    "message": "Parameter from and to are mandatory",
    "data": null,
    "error_code": "0003",
    "error_message": "Parameter from and to are missing"
}

message.example: Parameter from and to are mandatory

error_message.example: Parameter from and to are missing

post.description: This API helps you to categorize transactions based on a description.

parameters.name: public_access_token
parameters.description: Unique identifier for client

transaction_description_text.description: Transaction description from the financial Statements

bankId.description: Destination ID related to the transaction

direction.description: The direction of fund. Should be either in or out. in is for money in & out is for money out.

amount.description: Optional. To separate transaction with same description that happened in almost the same time

reference_id.description: Optional. Reference ID of certain transaction

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for clients(Public access token)

bankShortCode.description: Institution short code of the bank

referenceId.description: Unique ID that is being generated by the client to track each VA generation (maximum 255 characters)

displayName.description: The display name that will be shown in the user's payment platform (maximum 24 characters)

suffixNo.description: The customizable last 8 digits on the Virtual Account Numbers (Only available for BRI and Bank Sahabat Sampoerna)

code-samples.code:
curl  --request POST 'https://sandbox.onebrick.io/v1/payments/open-va' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer public_access_token' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{
    "bankShortCode": "BRI",
    "referenceId": "test_VA1",
    "displayName": "Open VA 1",
    "suffixNo": "88899902"
}'

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Unique token for clients(Public access token)

paymentMethodType.description: Only virtual bank account is available for now

amount.description: The amount that will be stated in the virtual account

description.description: The description that will be stated in the virtual account (maximum 255 characters)

expiredAt.description: The expiration time of the close VA (minimum 1 hour from request time and maximum 30 days from request time)

bankShortCode.description: Institution short code of the bank

referenceId.description: Unique ID that is being generated by the client to track each VA generation

displayName.description: The display name that will be shown in the user's payment platform (maximum 24 characters)

suffixNo.description: The customizable last 8 digits on the Virtual Account Numbers (Only available for BRI and Bank Sahabat Sampoerna)

code-samples.code:
curl  --request POST 'https://sandbox.onebrick.io/v1/payments/close-va' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer public_access_token' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{
    "paymentMethodType": "virtual_bank_account",
    "amount": 15000,
    "referenceId": "test_VA2",
    "expiredAt": "2021-12-31T09:07:04+07:00",
    "description": "Transaction 1 paymente",
    "paymentMethodOptions":
    {
        "bankShortCode": "BRI",
        "displayName": "Close VA 1",
        "suffixNo": "91909265"
    }
}'

parameters.description: Unique identifier for clients(Public access token)

parameters.name: VA-ID
parameters.description: Unique id of virtual account

post.description: The Identity endpoint allows developers to upload the passbook and monthly financial statement documents with the format: PDF, PNG, XLS, or JPEG and with a maximum size of 5 MB / file.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Unique identifier for client(Public access token)

files.description: The financial statement file, PDF, PNG , XLS, or JPEG with a maximum size of 5 MB / file.

get.description: Once the digitization process is done, Brick will notify your platform with callbacks that will notify you of the responses of the document digitization. You need to register your Webhook URL to Brick from the Brick Developer Dashboard. If there is no Webhook URL present, then the responses will be sent to Email (attached as CSV) automatically. The email will be the same as the one registered with your brick account.

post.description: This API is for simulation to test the open VA process, This API is only available in a Sandbox environment.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Unique token for clients

parameters.name: VA-ID
parameters.description: ID of VA that is generated by Brick in the VA generation API response for simulating "paid" status, ID of Payment that is generated by Brick in the VA callback response for simulating "completed" status

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The status that want to be achieved (paid / completed)

post.description: This endpoint can be used to refresh the session of institution with MFA by sending new OTP to end user. Currently, E-Wallet and Institution with Security Question can use this customization.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for client(User access token)

message.example: An OTP is required by the institution to login
An answer to a security question is required by the institution.

patch.description: This endpoint can be used to retrieve latest list of accounts or products (and their associated data) held by the End User with a Provider by providing new OTP to refresh the account session. Currently, E-Wallet and Institution with Security Question can use this customization.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for users(User access token)

token.description: OTP from the end-user (for E-Wallet) or The answer to the given security question (for Institution with Security Question)

sessionId.description: Unique Id that generated after successful connection

post.description: This endpoint can be used to refresh the session of institution with MFA by sending new OTP to end user. Currently, E-Wallet and Institution with Security Question can use this customization.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for client(User access token)

message.example: An OTP is required by the institution to login
An answer to a security question is required by the institution.

patch.description: This endpoint can be used to retrieve data associated with the specified ‘account_id’ by providing new OTP to refresh the account session. Currently, E-Wallet and Institution with Security Question can use this customization.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for user(User access token)

token.description: OTP from the end-user (for E-Wallet) or The answer to the given security question (for Institution with Security Question)

sessionId.description: Unique Id that generated after successful connection

accountId.description: Id of the account as a parameter

patch.description: This endpoint can be used to retrieve all transactions for the account connected by a user by providing new OTP to refresh the account session. Currently, E-Wallet can use this customization.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Unique Identifier of end user(User access token)

token.description: OTP from the end-user (for E-Wallet) or The answer to the given security question (for Institution with Security Question)

sessionId.description: Unique Id that generated after successful connection

from.description: Returns transactions posted on or after this date. Default value is date as of the API request minus 3 months

to.description: Returns transactions up to and including this date. Default value is date as of the API request

patch.description: This API helps you to get investment account's transactional data of your end-users.

parameters.name: user_access_token
parameters.description: Unique identification token for end user.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Returns transactions posted on or after this date

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Returns transactions up to and including this date

get.description: This API returns all previously connected account data of your users by providing PII (Email and/or Phone Number)

consent_id.description: [Mandatory] partner generated consent identifier that is unique per user

consent_method.description: [Mandatory] the consent method used to gather consent from user

message.example: Request Id already in use.Please provide a new request id

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request POST 'https://sandbox.onebrick.io/v1/account/pii' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer user_access_token' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{
		"consent_id": "consentABC001",
    "consent_method": "Web Application - Button Click",
    "email": "pasek@gmail.com",
    "phone_number": "628116780777"
}'

get.description: This API helps you to get company's identity data

address.example: Gedung ABCD Jalan Letjend Sudirman No 111

get.summary: Corporate Tax Data - Company Reporting History
get.description: This API helps you to get company's history of reports that is usually done on monthly or yearly basis

parameters.description: The year of the desired reporting history list
